column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column7: We have committed to respecting human rights as set out in the International Bill of Human Rights and stand with local and international efforts to combat modern slavery, as detailed within our Human Rights Policy. In 2023, we continued to work with our industry peers through the Telco Together Foundation to bring an industry-based approach to identifying and addressing modern slavery risks in our operations and supply chain.

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
column7: Comprehensive training is provided to our retail and call centre staff, focusing on customers experiencing vulnerability and those with accessibility needs. This enables them to identify and assist customers who are vulnerable or suffering hardship.\t

Operations that have been subject to human rights reviews or impacts assessments
column13: TPG Telecom is committed to providing a safe and respectful environment for employees and customers, free from discrimination, bullying and sexual harassment. To support our approach, we maintain a mandatory Respect@Work learning module to enable all employees and leaders to understand how to respond to inappropriate behaviour.

column6: Operations that have been subject to human rights reviews or impacts assessments
column13: In 2023, we commenced a partnership with Our Watch to support the establishment of a framework for implementing their Workplace Equality and Respect approach. Our Watch is a national leader in the primary prevention of violence against women and their children in Australia. Together, we have conducted a comprehensive analysis of our current approach to identify further reasonable steps TPG Telecom can take to prevent harassment and other forms of gendered violence from occurring in our workplaces.
column20: Our Watch partnership, Violence Prevention, Workplace equality

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column7: We launched training for all our employees to raise awareness of modern slavery, particularly in the Telecommunications industry, which is susceptible to it.

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Consultation was undertaken throughout 2023, including several workshops with leaders across the organisation, including people's experience, consumer, enterprise & government, technology, and procurement, to discuss the purpose of the RAP. These workshops enabled us to better understand how employees at all levels and functions can positively impact the RAP and respond to the actions under this plan. These workshops included critical leaders across our organisation participating in Masterclass sessions focusing on First Nations procurement, employment, and community engagement.
column20: Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP) consultations, Workshop, Process

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: More than 150 employees, including Executives, senior leaders, RAP Working Group members and others, have undertaken a cultural learning program. It includes workshops with Acknowledge This! to help empower them to deliver a meaningful, authentic, personal acknowledgment of their Country.
column20: Cultural learning program, Acknowledge This!, Working Group

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: We have an ongoing partnership with Aurora Education Foundation, for which we provided $100,000 in sponsorship to help launch their Intern Support Fund. Employees across TPG Telecom are joining our Barangaroo head office to volunteer their time and prepare resources for the Aurora Education Foundation's High School Program.\t

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: TPG Telecom is a signatory to the 'Telco Industry Domestic and Family Violence Pledge'. Through the Telco Together Foundation Impact Hub, we collaborated with leading Australian telcos to develop a DFV Action Framework. Launched in April 2022, this framework provides a consistent approach for telcos to address DFV and technology-facilitated abuse while supporting victims/survivors.
column20: Domestic and Family Violence (DFV) Pledge, Framework, Signatory

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: Following a successful pilot in 2022, the Skilled Volunteering Program was expanded to increase the impact of our people by leveraging their expertise and skills to support the Foundation's objectives. The 2023 program consisted of internal TPG Telecom teams collectively dedicating over 700 hours to assist three distinct charities with specific challenges our teams were well-placed to help solve.\t
column20: Skilled Volunteering Program, Charity support, Communities

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: We have received conditional endorsement from Reconciliation Australia for our Innovate RAP, which is ready for launch in 2024. Our Innovate RAP will allow us better to understand our impact and approach to advancing reconciliation. It will focus on developing and strengthening relationships with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, engaging employees and stakeholders in reconciliation, and developing and piloting innovative strategies to empower them.
column20: Innovate RAP, Reconciliation initiatives, Local Communities

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Internally, we screened our supplier list to improve supplier engagement efforts. We are also implementing a third-party, technology-enabled due diligence solution that will enable us to identify higher-risk suppliers.\t
column20: Supplier engagement, Due diligence solution, Risk Assessment

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Recognising the importance of robust supplier governance, we have a centralised procurement function underpinned by an organisation-wide procurement governance framework. We operate under a continual improvement approach, enabling us to manage the risks and opportunities presented by our large, complex supply chain.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column8: Comprehensive roadmap supplier due to diligent
column13: In 2023, we commissioned an independent review of our existing third-party risk management practices. We developed a comprehensive roadmap to improve the maturity of our supplier due diligence approach and risk assessment processes and tools. Our roadmap will help us better manage risk in our supply chain and enable us to work with suppliers that are aligned with our sustainability goals.
column20: Third-party risk review, Supplier roadmap, Independent Review

column8: Internal framework and customer vulnerability framework
column13: Effectively managing our internal framework for ongoing compliance with the Reducing Scam Calls and Scam SMS Industry Code. Developing a customer vulnerability framework and identifying opportunities for enhancing our services and support for customers experiencing vulnerability.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Critical threats from malicious actors, organised crime and nation-states include unauthorised access to our networks, systems and data. To strengthen our defences against these threats, we make significant investments in our systems and controls. These investments focus on four key areas: vulnerability remediation, expanding security capabilities, transforming IT architecture, and standardising policies and controls. In 2023, we significantly increased our technology security budget and more than doubled the size of the team focused on managing these risks.
column20: Cybersecurity investments, Security teams, IT Architecture

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: One innovative approach we have adopted is the creation of internal red (hackers) and blue (catchers) security teams to seek out and fix vulnerabilities before external parties can take advantage of them. Our ongoing program to address security risks in our business involves reducing vulnerabilities, upgrading platforms, and decommissioning legacy systems that have become difficult to protect. This multi-year program is a critical part of our efforts to improve the security of our business and customers continually.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: TPG Telecom has a robust privacy program with dedicated specialists who implement and manage policies and physical and technical controls. We also embed a privacy culture for our people through a detailed privacy training and awareness framework.
column20: Privacy program, Data protection, Privacy culture

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Our Information Security Management Framework (ISMF) manages data privacy and governance. This includes policies, standards and guidelines, and our cyber security program to protect against threat actors who may seek to damage our brand and telecommunications systems. The ISMF has been certified against ISO/IEC 27001:2013Ã¢ÂÂInformation Technology, Security Techniques, and Information Security Management Systems.\t
column20: Information Security Management Framework, Data privacy, Cybersecurity
